description: From psepho- (“pebble”) +‎ -ology (“study of”), drawing on the various definitions of Ancient Greek ψῆφος (psêphos, “pebble used for reckoning; pebble used for casting a vote”). The sense relating to elections was coined in 1948 by Frank Hardie.

entries.meaning: The predictive or statistical study of elections. [From 1952]
An ancient Greek method of numerology, similar to gematria.
